  (Please select one)' occp

output: html_document
runtime: shiny
---


```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read in raw data from the OCCP survey. These are the files downloaded from survey monkey saved as a .csv
raw_data_occp <- read.csv("data/occp.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# Pull out all responses for q12 (a choose all question), combine, turn into a tidy data format for further processing then determine 'question n'
q12 <- "What.is.your.top.preferred.method..that.is..favorite..of.using.cannabis...Please.select.one."

q12_all <- get_single_selection(raw_data_occp, q.name = q12) %>%
  inner_join(rec_ids, by = "id")
  
q12_n <- length(unique(q12_all$id))
```

```{r}
# Manipulate data into a graphable format
q12_plot <-
  q12_all %>%
  group_by(response) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent_all = count / sum(count)) %>%
  mutate(percent_responded = count / q12_n)
```

```{r}
# Plot with percents and response counts
r <- 
  ggplot(q12_plot, aes(x = reorder(response, count), y = percent_responded)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(label= paste(round(percent_responded,2), count, sep = "***")))

r
```

```{r}
# Save graph as PNG, plot data as csv, and all question data including response IDs as csv (save question n and N at end of plot file as "_x.x")
ggsave(filename = 'q12_top_preferred_method.png', plot = r, device = 'png')

write.csv(q12_plot, 'q12_top_preferred_method_386.csv', row.names = FALSE)

write.csv(q12_all, 'q12_top_preferred_method_ids.csv', row.names = FALSE)
```
